issue.title: Google Drive Mount becomes unresponsive

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Google Drive Mount becomes unresponsive a couple of times a day and has to be remounted.
Not seen the same behavor on ACD.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
1.36-250
1.36-251-g0b2b4243

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Ubuntu 16.04

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone mount --log-level DEBUG --dump-headers GoogleG3: /media/Cloud/
rclone mount --min-transaction-interval 100ms --log-level DEBUG --dump-headers GoogleG3: /media/Cloud/

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
2017/07/15 08:14:59 DEBUG : Movies/The Crooked Man (2016)/The.Crooked.Man.2016.1080p.WEB-DL.DD5.1.H264-FGT.mkv (w): >Write: written=8192, err=<nil>

issue.title: panic in handler for Flush

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
What is your rclone version (eg output from rclone -V)
1.36-251-g0b2b4243-tps-limitβ
Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Ubuntu 16.04
Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive
The command you were trying to run (eg rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp)
mount

issue.title: fuse: panic in handler for Rename - assignment to entry in nil map

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi Good, 

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
rclone v1.36-DEV

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux Debian 9.0 (64 bit)

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

Same problem as for ACD : 

- fuse: panic in handler for Rename #973
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/973

And 

- Rename Panic #1226
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1226

But i'm using GSuite (Google), and the last version in developpment for the test(s)

Please let me know.. 

Regards,

body:
I've fixed this in https://beta.rclone.org/v1.36-264-gc223464c/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Let me know if there are any problems with it ASAP please because I want to cut the 1.37 release this weekend!
@ncw Okay, will test it very soon. Just need to sync some files first. Should have a reply in an hour or two.
@ncw Its looking good, not been able to reproduce the error so far..
@ncw I'm confident this issue is resolved, not able to reproduce it. Great!

Excellent - thank you very much for testing :-)

Good to get this fix in to 1.37
